p: Over the past few years, there has been an increase in interest in research on the chemistry and biological activities of Artemisia species. This is undoubtedly connected with the awarding of the Nobel Prize in Medicine in 2015 for the discovery of artemisininâ€•a sesquiterpenoid lactone effective in the treatment of malaria, found in Artemisia annua (annual mugwort). A commonly known species of the genus Artemisia, with an important place in the history of medicine, is Artemisia absinthium L.
